The International Olive Oil Association categorizes olive oil into two main types: Virgin Olive Oil (VOO) and Refined Olive Oil (Lampante Olive Oil or ROO), with five levels each.
Extra virgin olive oil, also known as natural olive oil, is obtained by mechanically cold-pressing fresh olives and then filtering out impurities.

Based on acidity levels, there are three categories:

1. Acidic: pH less than 7
2. Neutral: pH equal to 7
3. Basic: pH greater than 7
Extra Virgin Olive Oil (Extra Virgin): It is the highest level and highest quality olive oil, it is a pure natural product.
The taste is excellent, with a subtle and refreshing aroma of plants, acidity not exceeding 1%.
Fine Virgin Olive Oil: Acidity level slightly high, not more than 2%, taste pure, aromatic.
Ordinary Virgin Olive Oil: Taste and aroma are acceptable, acidity does not exceed 3.3%.
Refined olive oil refers to olive oil obtained from first pressing with an acidity level exceeding 3.3%, often referred to as "second press oil."
Refined olive oil can be divided into two levels:
Refined Olive Oil: Blend of Refined Olive Oil and a certain proportion of Virgin Olive Oil, balanced in taste and color. Acidity below 1.5%, translucent pale yellow.
Refined Olive-Pomace Oil: Obtained by extracting and refining from olive pomace through a solvent process.
You should have noticed if you have seen the level classification, the acidity of olive oil is an important indicator.
Olives are similar to grapes in winemaking, with olives from different growing regions and olive varieties producing different grades of olive oil.
The best growing place for olive oil: [This phrase is not complete in Chinese as it is missing the name of the specific place or region.]
The Mediterranean coast has the most suitable soil and climate conditions for olive tree growth, including temperature, sunlight, humidity, and precipitation.
Outside the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, other regions can only scatter plant cultivation in suitable areas.
Principal production bases (Mediterranean):

Italy, Spain, Greece, Turkey, Portugal, Morocco, Syria, Israel, Tunisia, Algeria, Egypt, Pakistan, Lebanon, and others, are similar in climate to Argentina, Peru, and South Africa, which are located further south.

Olive harvest month:

Note: In this context, "油橄榄" refers to olives.

Every year, oil palm trees bloom and bear fruit between March and June. The fruits begin to develop and ripen from July to October. They transition from green to red, then purple, and finally turn black.
From November to the following February is the season for harvesting fruits (the freshness of olive oil is quite important).
Olive oil nutritional components:
Olive oil is rich in monounsaturated fatty acids, specifically oleic acid and omega-9 fatty acids, as well as vitamins A, B, D, E, K, and antioxidants.
Olive oil is recognized as the most beneficial oil for human nutrition among all the oils discovered so far.
The Democratic Summit has concluded, and Biden declares that the flame of freedom will never be extinguished.
The "Summit for Democracy" hosted by U.S. President Biden with the participation of over 110 governments, civil society leaders, and private sector heads concluded on Friday, December 10th.
Biden, in his closing remarks, said that the flame of freedom burns in the hearts of every person in the world, and despotic regimes can never extinguish it.
He also expressed that the second Global "Democracy Summit" will be held next year.
The representative of the Taiwan government, Wang Tang, and the Hong Kong democracy activist, Joshua Wong, who is currently in exile in the UK, spoke at the summit on the second day.
Biden said: "We are aware of the immense challenge that lies before us."
But we also know that we can welcome challenges, as I mentioned before, as this summit shows, the democratic world is ever-present.
A dictatorship can never extinguish the small flames of freedom burning in people's hearts all over the world.
Biden also stressed that defending democracy requires the collective effort of the entire society.

As leaders of the government, we have the responsibility to listen to our citizens, strengthen the democratic guardrails, drive reforms, ensure transparent accountability, and are better equipped to withstand the buffeting and impact of authoritarian forces, as well as those who seek to barelessly pursue power at the expense of public interest.

The theme for the second day of the "Democratic Summit" are: Defending Human Rights, Consolidating Democracy and Resisting Authoritarianism, and Countering Digital Authoritarianism and Affirming Democratic Values.
Today happens to be "International Human Rights Day."

UN Secretary-General Guterres also stated in his opening speech that the cause of democracy is facing challenges on a global scale, particularly the challenges brought about by emerging digital technology.
He said: "It's time to reaffirm our shared values and positions, as well as our democratic resilience."

This requires deepening social dialogue, addressing inequality issues, combating corruption, updating social contracts, investing in quality education, and expanding opportunities for women and girls.
This also requires firm condemnation of all forms of chauvinism, localism, and extremism, including those provided by technological revolutions.

Hong Kong democracy activist Joshua Wong delivered a speech at the conference through a pre-recorded video, reminding participants to continue paying attention to the human rights situation in Hong Kong and the ethnic minorities in China, including the Uighurs and Tibetans.
He said: "For a long time, the world has witnessed China's rise but has not established a mechanism to hold it accountable."
This is why political figures and leaders of civil society must work together.
We must utilize all our resources (assets) to ensure the revival of democracy is our top priority.
Luo Guancong also urged the free world to unite and resist the threats from the Chinese Communist Party.

"Some among you may fear displeasing Xi Jinping, the CCP general secretary. Some among you may not want to lose the Chinese market. Some among you may not have realized the threat the CCP poses to our democratic values."
This is the reason for our failure.
This is one of the reasons we must change.

Taiwan Executive Yuan Administrative Council Member Tang Fen spoke at a roundtable discussion titled "Fighting Digital Authoritarianism, Affirming Democratic Values," and released a national statement via video, emphasizing that Taiwan stands at the forefront of opposing despotism and authoritarianism.
He also shared his experiences on how to combat the Covid-19 pandemic through information transparency and building trust.

He said: "During the democratic development of Taiwan, we have always firmly stood at the forefront of global opposition to authoritarianism, and have also played a leading role in promoting global freedom, democracy, and human rights."

During the epidemic, authoritarian governments at various locations, under the guise of public health and collective interest, rationalized infringements on human rights, presenting signs of global democratic regression.
In Taiwan, we don't need to impose a lockdown to control the epidemic, and we don't need to take down [content] to win against disinformation.

The United States Treasury Department announced the implementation of legal sanctions against 15 individuals and 10 entities from China, North Korea, and other countries, during the schedule of the "Democracy Summit" on its second day. Additionally, a Chinese company that was identified as using surveillance technology to aid in human rights violations was subjected to investment restrictions.

Since 2016, Jiangxi Province has planned to train and qualify one music, art, and physical education teacher for each rural primary school in the province (including towns and below) within three years, totaling 10,000 teachers.

According to the information available, this training is intended for teachers in Jiangxi Province below the age of 45, who have a foundation or ability in music, art, or physical education subjects, and can teach other academic subjects while also handling music, art, or physical education courses.

Through training, enable them to master the basic knowledge and teaching skills of aesthetic education, update teaching ideas and concepts, grasp modern teaching methods, enhance scientific teaching ability, activity design ability, campus culture ability, and self-development ability, construct a team of versatile aesthetic education teachers, alleviate the problem of shortage of rural aesthetic education teachers.

To ensure the quality and effectiveness of training, Jiangxi plans to train one teacher in music, art, and physical education in each of the hundred counties (cities, districts) in the province, totaling 300 trainers, comprehensively enhancing their teaching demonstration leading ability, training activity design and organization ability, implementation skills, and network training workshop construction ability, playing a role in teaching, demonstrating, guiding, and supervising.

The truth is, for overweight girls, choosing outfits requires great care.
A heavyset girl's skirt should not be too short or too long, the length should be around the knees, just long enough to cover the thicker parts of her thighs.
A short skirt exposes the thighs' plumpness.
It becomes giving a feeling of short, stout, if too long.

If you wear an outfit with distinct upper, middle, and lower parts, it will make you look naturally taller. This refers to a top, skirt, and long stockings in different colors, creating a sense of elongation.

Many dark-colored outfits are a must-have for plump girls (the author has a lot of experience with this), and dark colors are a good way to conceal a body's plumpness. High-class and elegant black skirts are a favorite among plump girls.
Wearing dark-colored clothes, especially a black skirt, makes you look slimmer.
If your calves are quite fat, avoid wearing socks or shoes that draw too much attention.
The more popular, the better, but not too vibrant with colors.
Make people pay attention to your legs and feet, making them feel plump.
For a slightly plump girl, there are some fashion tips on dressing up.

A plump girl should not wear tight-fitting miniskirts, and the top should not be too short or tucked into the skirt, which would make people uncomfortable. If her legs are thick, she should wear black long stockings or fishnet stockings, and choose a soft, flowing print skirt, paired with a blouse with a high neckline, to effectively conceal her shortcomings.
Of course, a plump girl pays attention to her appearance in a miniskirt as well.
A plump girl wearing a skirt should choose a top with a matching color to create the illusion of added height for her full figure.
A skirt paired with high heels can make your legs look longer, it's the most trendy combination for summer!
If you are plump overall but have thin legs, I would recommend a lovely-feeling maxi skirt.
It not only covers up your flaws, but also highlights your strengths.
An A-line skirt will make one look slimmer, more suitable for plump girls. The top should be chosen to be more fitted to create a layered effect and enhance the slimming effect.
A simple white T-shirt matches well with a skirt, even big size MM can try it.
A chubby girl can also wear fashionable clothes.
As long as plus-sized girls master the rules of clothing coordination, they will become the focal point of everyone's attention.
After making changes in how I dress, I should also live an active life and try to shed the label of being a "chubby girl" before it's too late 😊

A little girl serves as a target for her older sister: "It's okay if it's just a prick to the flesh" - Xinhua Net.
A girl is standing in front of a big wooden board in Hangzhou Wulin Square, with the words "Human Target, One Arrow for Ten Yuan" written on it.
Yesterday morning, a photo of a girl from Hangzhou volunteering as a "target" for her sister's fundraising went viral on social media.

The photo shows a girl in Hangzhou Wulin Square standing in front of a tall wooden board, on which is written "Human Target, One Arrow for Ten Yuan." The message indicates that people should pay ten yuan to use a bow and arrow to shoot.
That behavior has sparked heated discussions among netizens.

Last night, the spokesperson of the Propaganda Department of the Hangzhou City Public Security Bureau Downtown Sub-bureau confirmed to Xinjingbao Reporter that the girl's extreme behavior was due to her being a sister soliciting donations, but such behavior is not worth promoting. After being reprimanded, she had already left the local police station yesterday.
A girl on the street was warned for soliciting donations as a human target.

In the circulated image, a long-haired girl is shown standing in front of a large wooden board. The words "人肉靶子, 十元一箭" (rénròushāzi, shíyuán yījiàn), which mean "human target, ten yuan per arrow," are written on the wooden board in black ink in front of her. Another wooden board next to her displays her bank account number and her WeChat, Alipay accounts, etc.
This image caused controversy after it was posted online.
Some netizens consider this action to be "begging for attention," and many netizens express sympathy for it.
We found the situation around noon on the 23rd, approximately 10 am, while patrolling near the square. The onlookers had already gathered in numbers.
The female vendors at the scene of the incident, who were interviewed by local media by the Tianshui police station, are both around 20 years old and dressed youthfully and beautifully.

Among them, a girl who was made a "human target" continued to cry, asking passersby to play this game with her; another girl on the side was cheering her on, saying that her friend's sister is currently suffering from leukemia and urgently needs surgery funds, please help out.
We have contacted the local police in Guizhou and learned that the girl is raising funds for her sister's leukemia treatment.

Last night, the spokesperson of the Propaganda Department of the Hangzhou City Public Security Bureau Downtown Sub-bureau told Xinjingbao reporters that this girl's name is Ji Jia Li, and she is soliciting donations for her sister Ji Jia Yuan.
Due to the treatment costing over 300,000 yuan, I was at a loss as to how to raise funds in a short time and resorted to this behavior.

He said, throughout the process, one girl acted as the target, while the other was responsible for shooting, but neither of them participated directly. The entire process was observed by someone without anyone actually firing arrows being discovered. Only photographs were taken and posted on Weibo.

The arrow used by the police after the security department's assessment is not under control. (Note: This sentence is not clear without additional context as to what is meant by "the arrow" and "under control" in this context.)

However, a more accurate translation considering the given context would be:

The police assessment by the security department determined that the bow and arrow are not subject to regulation.
That manager stated, "We do not advocate using this sensational fundraising method."
After being warned by the police station, she left.

In a recent article titled "Watch Out! Project Managers Who Can Knock Down Gold Medals in Olympic Projects," project managers are described as always being the first movers in many projects, with no one able to keep up: carrying bricks, traveling, working late nights are part of their daily routine, while putting out fires, taking the blame, and apologizing are common occurrences.
The article may seem like a humorous take, but it reveals the bitter daily struggles of project managers, representing a lack of heart in current project management work.
The staff involved in project management are gradually choosing to take action to free themselves from the predicaments in their work.

The number of people signing up for PMP (Internationally certified Project Management Professional) each year is on the rise, indicating that more and more project management professionals are enhancing their skills through learning.

According to the "China Project Management Development Report (1999-2019)": as of September 2019, the total number of people who have applied for PMP certification in China is approximately 600,000, the number of people who have passed the certification is around 42,000, and the number of effective certificate holders is approximately 30,000, accounting for 31.2% of the global total of PMP certificate holders.

In the past 10 years, the number of PMP certificate holders has increased annually, indicating that more and more project managers are realizing that relying on simple copying of past "experience" is no longer sufficient. The rapidly changing work environment tells us that we must learn to explore the way forward by standing on the shoulders of scientific giants.

Passing the PMP exam guarantees smooth sailing in project management work?

Note: PMP refers to Project Management Professional, a certification offered by the Project Management Institute.

Many project management beginners express that by learning PMP/IPMP and related courses, they can systematically master the ten domains and five process groups in project management, but they still feel confused when actually performing project management work.

Many project managers often report the following issues: Inadequate understanding of project management, relying solely on personal experience with insufficient project management theories, unable to put theory into practice; Lack of a systematic project management process support system, unable to implement in practice, inaccurate project estimation, poor control flexibility, projects are constantly delayed; Unclear member roles, unable to handle "old hands" in the team; Cross-department communication is not smooth, making it difficult to advance the project ...

Skyworth Consulting brings the "Product Development Project Manager Special Training Camp" online course with it.

"Development Project Manager Bootcamp" is an online course that offers fragmented learning, integrating numerous real-life cases, tools, and methods from development-oriented enterprises. It assists you in mastering essential project manager knowledge and standard actions, paving your way to advanced project management.
This also provides opportunities for project managers in the enterprise to be trained at lower costs and less investment, promoting efficient operational results.

You can check out what other students have to say about this course before making a decision: This course is taught by the Zhongtian Huaxia Expert Team (formerly of Huawei Research and Development Management Team), combining international advanced project management methodologies and numerous real-life business scenarios from well-known companies, to deliver in-depth and shallow professional explanations of the course content.
It also provides scientific and practical management tools and methods, rich template forms, helping students apply learned content to specific work in their free time.

Jiemian "Double Twelve" eve promotes rational consumption to consumers - Economic Observer - Professional Financial News Website.
This year, the total transaction amount of online payments during the "Double Eleven" shopping festival reached 1.77 trillion yuan, setting a new record compared to previous years.

The abundant discount coupons with various designs once again captured people's attention during the live broadcast shopping, bringing consumers significant benefits. This consumption trend not only amazes people with the growing consumer power of the population, but also requires us to calm down and ponder the impact of consumerism on society and today's mainstream consumer groups.

Before the arrival of "Double Twelve" [a shopping festival in China], Jietong Consumer Finance Co., Ltd. (hereafter referred to as "Jietong") issued a call for rational consumption, reminding all users, especially the young, to establish good consumption consciousness and habits, and to reject blind and excessive consumption.

According to the Consumer Financial Literacy Survey Analysis Report released by the People's Bank of China, the national consumer financial literacy index is 66.81, which is 2.04 points higher than in 2019.

Overall, Chinese residents show good performance in financial consumption, but exhibit significant differences in financial behavior and skills, requiring further improvement in basic financial literacy.

Elderly people and young people have relatively low financial literacy levels, with "one old and one young" remaining the focus of financial education; Nelson's "China Young People's Debt Report" and CCTV Finance's "2019-2020 China Youth Consumption Report" show that young people have great consumption potential, and credit consumption is an important way to upgrade consumption. Eighty-six point six percent of young people use credit products, and nearly half of them have no accumulated debt. Although young people as a whole show a rational consumption trend, they are different from the external labels of "excessive spending" and "following trends," but some young people indeed exhibit excessive consumption and imitative consumption behaviors, resulting in excessive financial pressure and debt risk, even leading to social problems that are gradually increasing. Financial institutions should take on social responsibility and engage in positive guidance.

As a licensed consumer financial institution, Jiefax has always been dedicated to providing high-quality, caring services to help people build their happy lives, promoting good and correct consumption habits among consumers, and actively responding to regulatory calls by taking practical actions to enhance the rational consumption consciousness of consumers, especially the young population.

In the past few years, Jiefax has conducted comprehensive and diverse financial literacy activities targeting young populations including college students, and guided their consumer needs reasonably through various forms such as cooperating with top domestic universities to launch innovation and practice competitions. This helps them establish rational consumption concepts, plan their consumption needs, and ultimately lays the foundation for them to accumulate wealth in their lives.

Just before the Twelfth Day, Jieshao reminds all consumer friends to establish rational consumption consciousness and correct financial views, resist mindless and excessive consumption, avoid the pitfalls of consumer credit, to prevent affecting personal credit reports and future economic life.
Consumption should be planned in advance, and abilities should be assessed to make timely repayments.
If overdue, overdue records will be recorded in your personal credit report, which may negatively impact future car purchases, real estate transactions, and other economic living situations.

At the same time, when enjoying financial products and services, one should also choose regular institutions and channels, and pay attention to verifying if the relevant institutions possess the necessary business qualifications.

In the future, Jietong will continue to rely on its mature and reliable consumer financial system, as well as constantly updating and innovating financial products, to provide consumers with more customized and diverse services. We will continue to help the masses raise their financial literacy, cultivate the concept of rational consumption and moderate borrowing, and become a trusted lifelong financial partner for consumers.

Vietnamese People's Newspaper - The Hong Kong and Macao Cooperation Committee Addresses Common Challenges
The stopping stations of Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman of Saudi Arabia include Amman (Jordan), United Arab Emirates (UAE), Qatar, Bahrain, and Kuwait.
Noteworthy is that this is the first visit of the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia and its Arab allies to Qatar since they imposed a blockade on Qatar in 2017, leading to a diplomatic crisis in the Gulf.

In this crisis, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain, and Egypt have severed diplomatic relations with Qatar and imposed a comprehensive ban, accusing Qatar of supporting terrorist organizations and having close ties with Iran.

The tense and serious state of international relations has adversely affected the internal unity of the ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations) and had a negative impact on the economies of the relevant countries in the region.
Four Arab countries have blocked all land, sea, and air routes to Qatar.
This crisis was resolved at the ASEAN Summit in January 2021, with various ASEAN countries signing a US-Kuwait mediated agreement towards "unity and stability."
Saudi Arabia has reopened its border with Qatar.
Saudi Arabia and Egypt have appointed new ambassadors to each other in Qatar to work on restoring relations with Qatar firsthand.

The Arabization of Gulf countries in the Hong Kong issue is aimed at restoring relations with Qatar, driven by the requirement for the interests of various countries and regional stability, with the intention of addressing common challenges.
During this visit of the Saudi Crown Prince to Oman, the two sides agreed to open the first direct land route between the neighboring countries of the two Gulf waters.
A channel connecting the two countries, spanning over 725 kilometers, will provide convenient conditions for travel and supply chain integration for the citizens of both countries.
The Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia (PIF) will invest $50 billion in Amman, and the two countries signed 13 cooperation waivers worth $300 billion.

The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia's visit to the Gulf countries coincides with Iran's negotiations with major world powers over the JCPOA, or the Comprehensive Iran Nuclear Deal, which Gulf Arab countries have criticized due to their inability to resolve the Iran missile issue.
Each country in the Gulf considers Iran as a long-term "competitor," and views Iran's nuclear program as a "threat" to regional security.
Each country in the Gulf believes that failing to resolve the Iran missile issue and taking no action to contain Iran's activities in the region is deficient.
Against the backdrop of failed nuclear talks between Iran and major countries, Saudi Arabia directly negotiated with Iran.
Its objective is to contain the escalation of tensions in that region.
This is one of the factors contributing to the economic growth of the Hong Kong and Macao Co-operation Committee.
The upcoming Gulf Cooperation Council summit will be the first such meeting among GCC countries since the resolution of disputes between some members and Qatar.

This is an opportunity for the Bay Area Cooperation Committee to reassess and make contributions to promote the unity of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region through diplomatic achievements, while proposing various measures for full cooperation among its members to address common challenges and contribute to the stability and development of Hong Kong countries.

Let the spirit of universities resonate with the spirit of the times - Xinhua Net.
The so-called university spirit refers to a series of educational principles and values that a university has accumulated over its development process, which is the soul of the university.
Since ancient times, the role of universities in political, economic, cultural, technological, and social development, not to mention the progress of a nation, has been of paramount importance.

From the world's first modern university, the university shouldered unique missions different from other social organizations. For our country's universities, they emerged during the period of national crisis, and their spirit was deeply influenced by both traditional culture and societal transformation. They advocated the values of "enlightening the world and benefiting society" and "promoting education and strengthening the nation" as patriotic duties.

In current circumstances, the trend towards ITization and internationalization in higher education is increasingly apparent, with global competition, tech competition, and talent competition intensifying. The higher education industry, as an important "supply side," faces unprecedented opportunities and challenges for its structural reforms.

The proposal of "Overall Plan for Promoting the Development of World-Class Universities and Disciplines in China" not only showcases our country's confidence and determination in transitioning from a higher education power to a higher education superpower, but also sets higher and more advanced requirements for university development.
How to rapidly advance and establish several world-class universities and disciplines within a certain gap, achieving "overtaking the competition" in a relatively short time?

Besides having firm confidence in goals, paths, and abilities, colleges should fully utilize three advantages: first, the late-mover advantage, by continuously introducing outstanding academic talent from abroad, learning from the advanced experiences of world-class universities, and achieving significant improvements in academic levels and school quality; second, the cultural advantage, by inheriting the wisdom accumulated over five thousand years of Chinese civilization, promoting the development of excellent traditional culture, and gathering strength, shaping the brand, and enhancing image; third, the institutional advantage, by leveraging the superiority of socialist systems, strengthening goal-drivenness, consolidating consensus and collective strength, optimizing resource allocation, and providing sustainable support for the school to catch up with and surpass advanced global levels.
It's important to note that building a world-class university cannot be achieved by imitating others; each school should showcase its unique strengths and characteristics.
The educational characteristics should have common Chinese features, while also reflecting unique goals, educational traditions, and resource endowments for each institution.

At Zhejiang University specifically, we emphasize three distinctive features in our education: first, we focus on innovative talent cultivation, building an integrated educational environment for science-education fusion and campus-enterprise cooperation, creating a full ecosystem for entrepreneurship education; second, we emphasize the interdisciplinary convergence feature, optimizing and adjusting the academic system, fostering an institutional environment for interdisciplinary studies, and actively nurturing emerging interdisciplinary sciences and significant interdisciplinary achievements; third, we emphasize the distinctive features of our educational system and social service, promoting in-depth international exchange and cooperation, and accelerating the formation of the comprehensive cooperation system between Zhejiang University, industry, and research.
In this process, it is especially important to always uphold the spirit of the university, making the university spirit resonate with the spirit of the times.

For Zhejiang University, the motto "Seeking Truth from Facts" and the shared values of "Study hard, Cultivate morality, Make distinctions, Be earnest" collectively constitute the latest expression of Zhejiang University's spirit.
This is an essential guarantee for the school to persist in the correct educational direction, accumulating cultural richness and concentrating spiritual power. It is profound and meaningful.

Among them, "Haihe River" emphasizes an open and inclusive spirit, reflecting the broad-minded attitude of "utilizing the world's elite talent for my cause"; "Qishan Huode" emphasizes the pursuit of truth and goodness spirit, indicating that the university should not only pursue truth but also receive the molding and character building of morality; "Kaiwu Qianmin" represents the reformative and innovative spirit, encompassing the pursuit of new knowledge and scientific research, as well as reform and development, and the renewal of the old; "Shu Wobangguo" emphasizes the patriotic and dedicated spirit, advocating that the university should always be in harmony with the destiny of the nation.
These ideas and values pursuits are the soul of Zhejiang University's 120-year history.
"The wise listen to the soundless, the sage sees the formless."

Chinese universities should firmly stand on the ground of China's unique socialist modernization, deeply grasp the historical mission of higher education in this era, and accelerate the construction of world-class universities.

Simultaneously, uphold humanitarian care and independence, allowing the spirit of the university to interact with the spirit of the times and the spirit of the nation, thereby providing endless motivation for the realization of national prosperity and national rejuvenation, and the fulfillment of the common human dream.

Xi Jinping's letter of greetings to the 2021 Dawning Science and Technology Forum - Xinhua Net
On December 11, 2021, Chairman of the State Council Xi Jinping extended his greetings to the 2021 Dawning Area Scientific Forum in a letter issued by Xinhua News Agency in Beijing.

Xi Jinping pointed out that the world is experiencing a major upheaval not seen in a century, with global tech innovation entering a period of intense activity. The new round of technological revolution and industrial transformation is having profound impacts on the global economic structure.

The Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area should focus on building an international technology innovation center, striving to construct a global technology innovation hub, and driving the development of emerging industries.

China is willing to work hand in hand with scientists from all over the world and international tech organizations, closely cooperate in international scientific and technological exchanges, strengthen research on major scientific issues, promote the resolution of common scientific and technological challenges, deepen cooperation on key scientific projects, and jointly advance the development of global science and technology, for the betterment of mankind.

The 2021 Dawning District Science Forum was held in Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, with the theme "Exploring the Future, Sharing Science," and was hosted by the People's Government of Guangdong Province.

The longest limit for college students in Guangxi to take a leave of absence for entrepreneurship is five years - Xinhua Net.

Xinhua News Agency, Nanning, May 19th, reporter Zhang Yan: Recently, the Education Department of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region disclosed to the reporter that starting from now, each university in Guangxi will implement the flexible education system, extending the leave of absence limit for university students, and the leave of absence period for students starting their own businesses can be extended by 2 to 5 years based on the original education system, with the leave of absence time being regarded as practical education time.

To promote the entrepreneurship and innovation abilities of college students, the education and human resources departments in Guangxi have joined forces to build a business platform, establishing more college student off-campus practice teaching bases, university science parks, college student entrepreneurship parks, and business incubation bases, providing external support for college students' entrepreneurship.

According to the requirements, by the year 2020, the size of innovation and entrepreneurship practice bases in universities should be over 30,000 square meters for undergraduate schools, and over 20,000 square meters for vocational schools.

The government encourages universities to set up innovation and entrepreneurship credits, giving priority support to students who perform exceptionally in innovation and entrepreneurship practice to change majors.
High school teachers should spend at least two months every two years training in industrial enterprises to enhance their awareness and capabilities for innovative education and entrepreneurship.

The education department of an autonomous region requires all universities in Guangxi to deeply implement the college student innovation and entrepreneurship training plan, striving to ensure that each university student participates in at least one such training program during their tenure.
High schools should actively organize students to participate in various types of innovation and entrepreneurship competitions, and provide financial support.
Australian National University: Grants Honorary Doctorates to 7 Distinguished Individuals.

The Australian University held the "2021 Honors and Master's Degree Conferment Ceremony" on the 11th of this month. Liu Zhenyi, Chen Kai, Jun'an Zhong, Lanjian Li, Xiangliang Li, Rulan Zhu, and Chaojiang Jiang were awarded the honorary doctorate degrees by the Australian University, in recognition of their outstanding achievements and significant contributions to society and education.

At the conferment ceremony, the Representative of the Chinese People's Association for Promoting Democracy and Administrative Vice-Governor, Mr. Ouyang Yuzhong, presented the honorary doctorate degrees to the Chairman of the Australian Council of the Chinese People's Association for Promoting Democracy, Mr. Lin Jingcheng, and the President of Australian National University, Professor Song Shenhua.

Professor Liu Zhongyi was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Education degree, Professor Chen Kai was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Philosophy in Philosophy degree, Professor Zhuravlev Zhumin was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Philosophy in Philosophy degree, Professor Li Lanjian was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Philosophy in Philosophy degree, Professor Li Xiangliang was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Business Administration degree, Professor Zhu Lizhen was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Philosophy in Philosophy degree, and Ms. Jiang Chao was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Philosophy in Philosophy degree.

Euro Yang first extends his heartfelt congratulations and deep respect to the seven outstanding individuals who have been awarded the honorary doctorate degrees. They have achieved the extraordinary in their respective fields and made outstanding contributions to the development of the country and the progress of the world. At the same time, Euro Yang expresses his most sincere blessings to the graduates and parents. He also expresses his deepest respect to the dedicated and scholarly faculty and staff of the university.

Professor Sun Yifeng of the Australian Humanities Research Institute delivered a eulogy for Professor Liu Zhongyi, expressing that he was a renowned economist with outstanding academic achievements and forward-thinking educational ideals, recognized globally.
Besides achieving success in economic development, economic growth, and the Asian economic sphere, he is also a far-sighted educational leader.
In a nutshell, he excels in various fields.
Sun Yifeng, at the announcement of the second memorial address for Professor Zhongcunxi, expressed that Professor Zhongcunxi was a pioneer in sustainable energy technology.
He was one of the three laureates of the 2014 Nobel Prize in Physics for inventing the blue light-emitting diode (LED).

Professor Zhong's invention not only fundamentally changed the lighting industry, but also led to the widespread application of white light diodes in daily life and industrial production, making a significant contribution to human welfare.

Professor Sun Yifeng spoke during the praise session for Lan Jian, expressing that Lan Jian, as a pioneer in China's artificial liver industry, created an effective Lan System for artificial liver, making significant breakthroughs in the treatment of severe liver inflammation and liver failure, significantly reducing the mortality rate of liver failure.

In the fight against the new coronavirus, her team's "Four Defenses Two Balances" plan, along with the technologies of artificial liver, microecology, and stem cells they proposed, significantly improved the critical care treatment rate.

Sun Yifeng, in expressing his praise for Professor Li Xiaolong, stated that he laid the foundation for innovative research in operational management, shaped the thinking and practice of supply chain theory, and fundamentally altered business models worldwide.
Li Xiaolang is famous for his exploration of the long-rod effect concept in popularizing event management, and he has also investigated measures to address this phenomenon.
In today's world, with the ongoing epidemic and tense economic situation, the ripple effect is becoming more apparent, leading to severe disruptions in supply chains.
Li Xiaolong conducts far-sighted research like coal in snow, assisting industries in addressing challenges, resulting in significant social value.

Ms. Sun Yifeng expressed during the reading of the accolades for Zhu Lizhan, that in her research work, she discovered a groundbreaking and innovative coloring technology for preparing samples, which has a high reputation among peers in the domestic and international tech community.

She was bestowed with esteemed titles such as Fellow of the International European Academy of Sciences and Technologies, and with her brilliant achievements, she earned the revered position she deserved in the world's scientific pantheon.

Chen Xinxuan, the deputy director of the Australian Centre for Chinese Medicine and Biotechnology at the Australian National University, spoke in praise of Professor Chen Kaijia during his acceptance speech. Professor Chen Kaijia's distinguished scientific achievements and significant contributions to the country, Macau, Macau University, and national key laboratories have earned him an esteemed international reputation and standing.
He significantly contributed to the development of traditional Chinese medicine in Macau and the Greater Bay Area, reflecting his dedication to the national mission for healthcare strategy.

The dean of the Australian Technology University expressed his heartfelt praise for Madam Jiang Chaohui during her tenure at the podium, stating that she has developed over 15 significant inventions and patents related to storage virtualization, navigation, file systems, and power management for the Jiang Dynasty. All of them are highly practical, widely used, and have significantly improved the convenience of human life.
As an accomplished inventor, Ms. Jiang is able to simplify complex technology and theories, making them accessible to the general public.
Lastly, Chen Kai read out the farewell speech on behalf of the honorary doctors.

He is very happy to see the medical industry in Macau and the Pearl River Delta region setting a good example: from the establishment of the first Chinese medicine quality research national key laboratory in Macau, to the vibrant development of traditional Chinese medicine in the Pearl River Delta, Macau has made a great contribution in attracting excellent talents in the integration of traditional Chinese medicine in the region.

Besides, he believes that the management team of Australia has far-sighted and brilliant vision. They not only provide research opportunities for students in academic aspects, but also contribute many responsible personnel to the society.
He is very fortunate to conduct exchanges and cooperation with Australia, and sincerely congratulates Australia on its recent achievements.

In the rush to fame of NFTs, the crypto community came up with another new concept.

In 2021, a blockchain game named "Axie Infinity" generated a huge impact in the Southeast Asian region. Some residents who lost job opportunities due to the pandemic started earning stable income from this game.

"Axie Infinity" is a pet-raising game with a blockchain base, featuring various gameplays that include NFTs. It currently holds the highest trading volume among NFT projects, surpassing 30 billion US dollars.
According to TokenTerminal data, Axie Infinity's daily revenue surpassed 820 million US dollars, approaching that of "King of Glory" (a popular Chinese game).
This year on August 6th, Axie Infinity announced that its daily active users have surpassed 100,000.

"Axie Infinity" spreads a new "play-to-earn" mode to more people, allowing players not only to derive joy and economic rewards from the game, but also to participate in the governance of the game ecosystem through blockchain and smart contracts.
This subjectivity is not conferred by the game developers, but is ensured by blockchain technology.

At the beginning of a new year, the first task is to summarize 2021 and adjust the tactical layout for 2022.
Tactics are about "doing things right."
The strategy is to "do the right thing," which means doing what is correct.
Strategy is about finding direction, tactics are about implementation. In most tactical thinking, there is room for strategic thinking.

To increase the number of customers (tactical thinking): Consider whether to deepen in the current field or expand to new domains (strategic thinking. To enhance customer retention rate (tactical thinking): Consider ways to boost retention for core and high-value customers (strategic thinking. In raising participation in activities (tactical thinking): Consider setting correct KPIs for activities, achieving the right targets, such as increasing target customer participation, activating dormant high-value customers, and precise customer acquisition. In increasing DAU (tactical thinking): Consider if the current growth is sustainable.
Born in 12 years, Bitcoin marked several milestone events in 2021.
September 7, the small country in Central America, El Salvador, declared Bitcoin as legal tender, marking the first time Bitcoin became a legal currency for a country or region.

On October 12, 2021, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) approved ProShares' eight-year-old first Bitcoin ETF, which was listed on the New York Stock Exchange, marking the first regulated Bitcoin futures ETF's debut on the US capital market, further expanding the cryptocurrency investment gap.
From a technological perspective of blockchain development, Bitcoin is not the leading role.

Bitcoin underwent a soft fork upgrade named "Taproot" on November 14, 2021. This upgrade enhanced the anonymity of Bitcoin network transactions and reduced the data burden in transactions by altering the blockchain's data structure.

Overdue registrants must provide proof of continuing education studies, not less than 30 hours in the past year for renewal registration, and not less than 120 hours in the past 4 years for re-registration, as well as at least 30 hours of continuing education studies for each completed year during the re-registration period.
Cost engineering consultant's continuing education fee standard.

Network continuing education engineering project participants are required to pay a registration fee to the relevant management organizations when registering. The standard fee for 30 hours of mandatory courses is generally 300 yuan per person per year (including continuing education uniform textbooks).
The cost for a 30-hour elective course per person per year is 300 yuan.
The cost for a 30-credit hour required course and a 30-credit hour elective course per person per year (including continuing education uniform textbooks) is 600 yuan.

(1) Attend continuing education courses for registered construction engineers organized by the China Quantity Surveying Association or provincial and departmental administrative institutions, and calculate study hours based on the recorded time in online learning materials.

(2) Attend central price association or provincial and departmental administrative institution organized registration engineering training, including concentrated training classes and seminars, which can be defined as 4 hours per half day.

(Three) Attend continuing education courses for pricing engineers and pricing staff of the China Quality Certification Center, each provincial level and department: 10 hours can be credited per half day.
(Four) Participating in provincial-level research projects, formulation of industry standards, and textbook writing; each item defined as 30 hours per year.
(Six) Writing examination materials and setting and marking questions for the National Cost Engineering Professional Qualification Exam, up to 30 hours can be defined as annual continuing education.
(Seven) formally published (with official publication number) engineering cost-related academic papers and works, signed individually and publicly.
For every ten thousand characters published, it is determined to be 12 hours of study.

In a national-level journal, each thousand characters is recognized as 8 hours of study; In a provincial-level journal, each thousand characters is recognized as 5 hours of study; In a municipal-level journal, each thousand characters is recognized as 3 hours of study.

Companies approved or authorized by the Price Mediation Committee, provincial-level and departmental administrative institutions, and provincial Price Association can offer public training to the public (excluding general management and skill training for enterprises). Each half day can be defined as 4 hours, with a maximum of 30 hours per year.

Asian-American groups file discrimination complaints against Yale and other Ivy League schools - Xinhua Net

Over 130 Asian American organizations filed a complaint with the US Education and Justice Departments on May 23, 2023, protesting discrimination against Asian applicants in the admissions process at three Ivy League schools - Yale University, Brown University, and Dartmouth College.
The Asian American Education Coalition, which initiated the appeal, held a press conference in Washington D.C. that day.

The chairman of this organization, Zhao Youkong, stated at a press conference that the number of Asian applicants who meet the criteria for admission to American Ivy League schools has grown significantly over the past 10 years. However, the proportion of Asians in these three Ivy League schools has remained relatively stable.
Many studies have shown that these colleges have systematically and persistently discriminated against Asian-American applicants in their holistic admission processes.
Zhao Yusheng introduced that in 2014, research by Sanders et al. showed that among all racial groups, Asians had the lowest admission rates relative to applicants in these three universities.

The US Department of Education's data shows that among Ivy League schools, Brown University and Duke University have the lowest acceptance rates for Asian students, and Yale University and Brown University have implemented racial quotas for Asian applicants for over 20 years.

Zhao Yuspace told Xinhua News Agency reporters that they hope the US Education and Justice Departments will conduct investigations after submitting appeals, and take measures to prevent these colleges from discriminating against Asians in admissions once the facts have been established.
They also hope that the school, upon being reported, will actively address this issue and change its admissions policy towards ethnic minorities.
The three schools under investigation have yet to respond.

The Asian American Education Alliance was established in 2015. At that time, it filed a complaint against Harvard University for alleged discrimination in admissions, but the US Department of Education did not accept it based on procedural reasons.
In addition to American Chinese organizations, there are also Indian, Korean, Japanese, and Pakistani American educational organizations participating in the appeal.

In September 2020, Mr. Lu learned about a factory located in Balitianzhen, Yuyao City, Zhejiang Province, from a real estate agent. After multiple site visits, Mr. Lu decided to buy the factory.

In December of the same year, Mr. Lu negotiated the details of purchasing a factory with the property owner's family member, Mr. Lin, and paid a down payment of 20,000 yuan through a bank transfer on the same day.

The person named Lin signed as the payee on the "Deposit Receipt for Factory Sale" with the provision that, "if the buyer does not wish to buy this factory, the deposit shall be returned to the seller; if the seller is unwilling to sell this factory, the deposit shall be doubled and returned to the seller. Both parties agree to sign the factory sale contract within one week."

Despite this, the parties were unable to reach a consensus on the sale scope of the factory, payment methods, and other major contract terms, resulting in the delay of the signing of the real estate purchase contract.
Considering that the two parties failed to reach a consensus on the contract content, Lin Some returned 20,000 yuan of the earnest money to Lu Shang several days later.

After great effort, Mr. Lu had finally chosen a house, paid the deposit, and prepared the down payment. All that was left was to sign the contract, but the seller refused to sell, leaving Mr. Lu feeling helpless and angry.
For this reason, Mr. Lu filed a lawsuit against Mr. Lin at the People's Court of Yuyao City.

The court, after reviewing the case, found that the parties ultimately failed to sign a formal contract, and it cannot be solely attributed to the defendant. Reasonably, it should be considered that the negotiations did not succeed. Therefore, this case should not apply the penalty fine provision, and the defendant is not required to pay double the deposit for breach of contract.
After the first-instance judgment, the plaintiff filed an appeal.
The appellate court upheld the original judgment recently.
Lawyer's Reminder: Exercise necessary caution and due diligence during the transaction process.

During the signing of a contract, as the buyer, one must exercise necessary due diligence, such as verifying the homeowner information and checking if the property is occupied, among other relevant information. The contract should clearly specify the delivery details, including time and location, to prevent disputes upon contract performance.

The Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson spoke on Saturday, December 11th, after the "Munich Security Conference" organized by the United States came to an end. They stated that the US holding the "Leaders' Democracy Summit" is "drawing ideological lines, turning democratic tools into weapons, and promoting division and opposition under the guise of democracy."

The Chinese government believes that for a long time, the United States has imposed its political system and value proposition on others, promoted "democratic reforms," excessively imposed unilateral sanctions, and instigated "color revolutions," resulting in catastrophic consequences.
"Democracy" has become a "large-scale lethal weapon" interfered by the United States in other countries.
This summit is a fulfillment of Biden's campaign promises.
The two-day meeting will be held via video conference, with leaders from 111 countries in attendance, including those from Taiwan. China and Russia were not invited.
Before the summit, China and Russia criticized the United States for issues with its own democracy, stating that the United States is not qualified to convene such a summit.

International criticism sounds, including the invitation of some leaders with authoritarian tendencies, such as those from the Philippines, Poland, and Brazil, raising doubts about the Biden administration's true intentions for organizing this summit, with some suspecting it is not for democracy but for geopolitical purposes.
The newly-elected German Chancellor Scholz also attended the Video Democracy Summit.

The Chinese Foreign Ministry's statement on Saturday declared, "The ugly state of American democracy was fully revealed today. The issues of money politics, identity politics, party opposition, political polarization, social division, racial conflicts, and income inequality have become more and more severe." American democracy is built on a capitalist foundation, a "rich man's game."

As the leader of the U.S. government, it is our responsibility to listen to our citizens, strengthen the guardrails of democracy, drive reform, ensure transparent accountable governance, and better withstand the buffeting and shock forces of authoritarianism and those who seek bare-faced power over public interest.
He stressed that democracy is not self-evident, " we must continually update it in every generation, in my view, this is the decisive challenge for our time. "
Biden also said, "Democracy and human rights face persistent and worrying challenges, and democracy needs defenders to protect it."
The United States has pledged to launch a one-year initiative worth $4.244 billion after this Democracy Summit, aimed at strengthening democracy worldwide and supporting independent news media.
The United States hopes that each country will make specific public commitments to improve their democratic systems before the planned entity democracy summit in late 2022.
"Let us all implement our commitments and report on the progress we have made by next year."

Education Pondering: How Can College Exams Make "Top Students" and "Failing Students" Each Succeed? - Xinhua Net

Three students of Lanzhou University wrote a letter to the school administration expressing their confusion over university exams and proposing to increase exam difficulty, change exam question types, and make exams accurately reflect students' actual abilities.
Indeed, college exams have always been a "hot topic."
In a university campus, students come from five lakes and six seas, with varying abilities, and learning progress uneven, resulting in vastly different learning situations.
For such a multifaceted group, there are varying perceptions, which is unavoidable.
Certainly, if the exam questions are of a single type, have a high repetition rate, and are overly simple, it will inevitably result in a completely different feeling.
Students who don't rely on cramming might pass the exams by intensive studying beforehand. If they think of other methods, they might achieve better results.

Such is the case that "failing students" can pass exams without putting in effort and even get high scores; "top students" never miss classes, have neat homework and notes, but their exam performance is not significantly different from others.
Based on this, the students' complaints about issues in Lanzhou University exams are not without reason, and this situation is likely not unique to Lanzhou University.
From this perspective, I would like to give a round of applause to these three students who write clear and straightforward letters.

In reality, it is common for people who have gone to college to engage in cramming for exams, devise various ways to obtain questions from teachers, compete for exam coverage, and secure special tutoring before the exams. Even during exams, sneaking in cheat sheets or seeking favor from teachers after the exams are not unheard of.

In my opinion, for evaluating the quality of teaching in a university, determining whether a student passes or fails an exam, is more about a teacher's comprehensive understanding of teaching and learning, and the scientific formulation of questions based on that foundation.
During the undergraduate stage of entering university, majors begin to specialize, and many major courses focus on fundamental knowledge.
It goes without saying that mastering the basic knowledge points of a subject is what university exams assess.

The knowledge acquired at the undergraduate level is mainly composed of fundamental theories and basic common sense from various disciplines, with limited room for change in terms of knowledge points, generally speaking, it is fixed.
The knowledge of mathematics learned in college twenty years ago is still important and relevant.
Although the knowledge points remain largely the same, it does not mean that the exam question types are single or that the questions are repetitive.

At many universities, exams are usually organized by forming question-setting groups, and the questionnaires are compiled by experienced teachers in the subject. The marking of exams is also conducted by all teachers in charge of the subject, which helps to a certain extent in preventing question repetition.

To draft a set of exam questions that align with teaching and learning practices, the topics should be based on the overall learning situation of students, with difficulty distributed normally. It is necessary to comprehensively grasp the teaching situation and analyze the students' learning progress in depth, enabling the exam questions to have dynamic control over difficulty and question types. This allows for effective assessment of both foundational knowledge and abilities, while also innovatively designing question types.

Examinations are the baton of university education. The type of examinations students face determines their study plans, and this trend influences the effectiveness of university education in the long run.
For students' suggestions, Lanzhou University's administration highly values it and has deployed rectification plans across the campus.

Each teaching unit is required to organize teachers to conduct discussions and course final exams with self-assessment, formulate exam paper topics and related regulations, strengthen supervision and inspection of exam paper setting and review, refine result evaluation, and enhance comprehensive assessment of all stages of course teaching.

From a mechanical perspective, addressing issues of single question types, repetitive questions, and so on in university examinations is a topic of concern. Of course, appropriate regulations are required, but the essence lies in teachers having a comprehensive understanding of the teaching situation. It's not just about mastering the teaching content, but also about mastering the students' learning situation. Both ends must be understood, allowing for better alignment between teaching and learning, resulting in positive interactions, and exams that are more reflective of reality. Consequently, "study kings" and "study failures" will each achieve their respective outcomes.

Sabah: 3,200 newborn babies have no birth certificates due to the special anti-counterfeit paper being out of stock.

(Yasulin, 11th) The Sabah National Registration Department announced that due to the depletion of special anti-counterfeit paper stocks, they have been unable to issue birth certificates to newborn infants since early October, affecting a total of 3,200 people to date.

The director of this branch, Karimulus, assured that all infants who have applied for birth certificates have been recorded in the system, and they will be reissued once the authenticity papers are delivered next week.
At a news conference, he addressed the ongoing reporting by a certain net media outlet on the printing issues of the Sandaba Daily for over ten months.
He mentioned that the issue had arisen two months ago, and Sahara also faced the same problem.
One reason is that Chinese manufacturers of anti-counterfeit paper have been affected by the epidemic, causing delays in delivery to our country.
He explained that the anti-counterfeit paper used by the Sarawak Tribune in Sabah is different from that in other regions, so they cannot borrow each other's inventory.

Klaus Ammann revealed that the latest batch of anti-counterfeit paper has arrived in Kuala Lumpur on the 6th of this month and was handed over to the printing company on the 8th for partial printing work.

The bureau will send people to Kuala Lumpur to pick up goods on Thursday, and will immediately proceed with the final printing stage in Sabah upon return. It is estimated that the applicants can receive the goods around December 20th (approximately 2 working days later).
We will notify the applicants to go to the respective sub-district offices to collect the application forms.
He has supplemented, a total of 22,481 birth certificates have been issued in Sabah this year.

Education News: Beijing Reduces the Proportion of Gifted Students in Middle School Entrance Exam for 2016 - Xinhua Net
The entrance exams for gifted students in Beijing City's middle schools are being uniformly organized by the district education committees on the 21st and 22nd.
This year, each district in Beijing has compressed the enrollment ratio for gifted students, making the competition among gifted students even more intense.

In Dongcheng District, the proportion of special ability students entering primary to middle school should not exceed 5% of the total enrollment plan for the district, with a total enrollment of 380 students. The proportion of students admitted to school should not exceed 10% of the school's enrollment plan.
Students with athletic, artistic, or technological talents who register online are eligible for the special talents admission exam.

To facilitate students to conveniently take the examination, Dongcheng District continues last year's examination arrangement, setting up 1-2 examination sites in each school district, with a total of 13 examination sites.

The examination points are divided by examination zones and in hours as the basis for dividing time periods. Students are required to enter the examination points in different examination rooms within the same zone at the designated time periods for the examination on that day.

The list of students who passed the examination in the May 23rd district education admission exam is published on the examination center's website, where students can check their examination results online.

The State Council's joint prevention and control mechanism requires strengthening the epidemic control at border cities after 48 hours of negative nucleic acid test results - Xinhua Net.

The State Council's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism recently issued a notice regarding strengthening the control work of the new coronavirus pneumonia epidemic situation in border cities and ports. Starting from the near future, individuals leaving border cities and ports (excluding those connected to Hong Kong and Macau) must hold nucleic acid test certificates showing negative results within 48 hours before departure. Upon arrival at land border cities and ports, individuals must undergo at least one nucleic acid test.
Based on the notice, the time frame for the above-mentioned requirements is from the date of announcement of the port cities in each province, city, and county, to March 15, 2022.
In addition, the notice also suggests that conditionally, border cities can study setting up quarantine buffer zones within their jurisdiction.

The heads of the Disease Prevention and Control Bureau under the National Health and Health Commission introduced that for some border cities, cross-border trade is the main economic pillar, and there is frequent border population flow between the two sides.

Implement zoned differential management policies, turning one containment line into two, which may achieve forward movement of checkpoints, compress epidemic outbreak risks, and achieve the greatest effect in disease control with the least social impact and lowest social cost.
In recent times, there have been several local cluster outbreaks of diseases in our country, all of which were input from border city outbreak areas abroad.

The aforementioned notice points out issues such as delayed monitoring of local epidemic situations, failure to implement closed-loop management for high-risk personnel, inadequate periodic nucleic acid testing, incomplete disinfection at cold chain product transmission points, irregular management of quarantine facilities, and insufficiently scientific and precise emergency response to the epidemic.

Notification Requires: Focus on perfecting the quarantine city epidemic prevention mechanism, improving the epidemic monitoring and warning system, implementing border control measures, and other aspects to quickly make up for the shortcomings of the quarantine city's prevention and control. Do not relax, do scientific and precise prevention work, and weave a dense and firm external defense line against input.

Notices emphasize that each border city should synchronize the research and deployment of epidemic control and living security work, publicly announce and freely circulate living security hotlines, regularly inspect potential risks in the supply of basic living materials and prices, and promptly address and actively respond to prominent issues raised by the public.

Based on the notice, the border cities indicated include those in counties (cities, districts, banners), cities (prefectures, provinces, leagues), and directly-administered municipalities where open land, water, and air ports are located. The specific scope is to be determined and announced by each province (autonomous region, directly-administered municipality) based on epidemic control requirements.

By chance, I came across an article discussing why this customer chooses to have their canning done by a logistics company in a free trade zone, despite canning being considered deep processing and not within the business scope of free trade logistics companies. The following text may provide an explanation for the customer's decision.
I have visited many baby formula factories and have come into contact with numerous production lines for baby formula.
In reality, the ingredients for powdered milk and liquid milk are identical. There is no difference between them.
Why is the warranty period for bagged products one year, while that for audio products is two years or more?
Why is the price difference so big between listening decors and bag decors?
Many consumers, or moms in particular, believe that the quality is much better because the raw materials are different.
The materials are actually the same, but people think they're valuable just because others consider them expensive.
Some consumers, with this mindset, have reportedly found the taste or texture to be different after eating, despite it being the same product.
Now I'd like to explain to everyone why some things are considered valuable. The reason for their value lies in...
Why is the price difference so great between their raw materials?

Because manufacturers consider that if the price per bag is too high, consumers will find it hard to accept, which means the manufacturer's profit is low or even non-existent. So, what does the manufacturer survive on?
Therefore, they have a significant markup in the pricing of their products to secure their profit margin.
Therefore, most manufacturers primarily promote listening bags instead of backpacks.
How many thousands or even billions of dollars do you still have in mind for annual advertising expenses from all those manufacturers?
Everyone can imagine.
With the development of society, marketing expenses, such as salespeople in malls, display fees in malls, product gift fees, and advertising costs, are continuously increasing.

Therefore, each manufacturer is continuously adding new products, and they are high-end products, with prices that are constantly rising. In reality, these are new products resulting from increasing market costs.
The main purpose is to earn higher profits, and their material costs at most will not exceed 3-4 yuan.
Some brands, to promote their products, use underhanded tactics and form partnerships with doctors in hospitals, earning profits ranging from 30 to 80 yuan per consultation.
Such operations are strictly prohibited by the relevant Chinese laws. In fact, this approach is consumer deceit.
It is suggested to buy bagged powdered milk and store it in cans at home. This way, you can save costs, enhance the milk powder's shelf life and airtightness, without affecting the baby in any way.

Not everyone should assume that the warranty period for sealed packaging is longer than that for bagged packaging. If the warranty periods for sealed and bagged packaging are the same after opening, the only difference is that sealed packaging is easier to preserve and less susceptible to moisture damage after opening.

Don't scare people at the starting line - Xinhua Net
Browse through a bookstore, and you'll often sense the popularity of self-help books.
Many self-help books of today advocate "the best practices," which imply or assume that you can "achieve it," before explaining what you need to do.
Skipping over the crucial and fundamental "how to" part.
These books all have a common trait: either give it your all and do your best, or don't do anything at all; either it's a hundred percent, or it's nothing; either climb Mount Tai, or just stay put.
This "best practice principle" is one that everyone would agree is "perfectly correct," but 99% of people would still be intimidated and frozen at the starting line.
Because this theory advocates a "you must grit your teeth and make a 180-degree change, become a new person" path, which happens to be a fatal weakness for many people.

For those who cling to traditions, insist on routine, and reject change, it is quite absurd of you to loudly proclaim "you must change" at their earside. This is clearly an act of self-deception and a futile attempt to move a mountain.

Most people are hesitant and reluctant to make changes, often unable to muster the courage to make a decision; or they make hasty decisions to change based on momentary impulses, taking the first step boldly, but usually the good times don't last long, and they soon give up, unable to persist.
Master Ma Sanli's famous crosstalk piece "Starting from Tomorrow" brilliantly portrays this "universal human trait" as a classic.
The biggest problem with the "best practices" is that the threshold is too high, often exceeding the capabilities of the average person, leaving the majority in awe but unable to implement it.
Perhaps, "the next-door principle" is a way that could lead more ordinary people to a relatively successful path.

The essence of "the next-step principle" lies in "lowering the threshold" — it encourages a theory of "winning through small victories." If you can't do a hundred, doing one is sufficient: one is always greater than zero. If you can't climb Mount Tai, climbing the small hill at your doorstep is still better than standing still.
In summary, doing something is always better than not doing anything.
Due to the significant reduction in barriers, there are more possibilities for ordinary people to persist, and the probability of success increases with persistence in any event.
The path to success is merely following the "second-best principle," which is just a little longer.

In summary, "the best principle" may seem to encourage everyone to succeed on the surface, but it ultimately inspires only a few. Conversely, "the second-best principle" is more effective in inspiring more people and benefiting as many as possible.

The Qinghai Lake bareoid resource reserves have increased by 0.71 million tons this year - Xinhua Net.

The latest monitoring results show that the resource reserves of naked carp in Qinghai Lake have increased by 0.71 million tons this year compared to last year, reaching 10.85 million tons. Compared to the early protection period in 2002, the accumulated increase is over 40-fold.

The rare fish species named "Qinghai Lake carp" or "Chess fish" in the Qinghai Lake is a precious fish species unique to the Qinghai Lake. It plays an important role in maintaining the ecological security and biodiversity of the "water-fish-bird" ecosystem in the Qinghai Lake basin.

In the 1960s and 1970s, influenced by factors such as massive capture of carps, degradation of breeding water environments, the population of naked carps in Qinghai Lake significantly decreased. By 2002, the hidden resources of naked carps in Qinghai Lake were only 2592 tons.
In the "Chinese Red List of Endangered Species" published in 2004, the naked carp in Qinghai Lake was listed as an endangered species.

Since 2003, Qinghai Province has implemented fish farming and banned any unit, collective, or individual from catching naked carp in Qinghai Lake and its major rivers and tributaries. It is also prohibited to sell naked carp and its products.

At the same time, by increasing water supply and irrigation, and designing scientific "fish passageways," among other measures, the protective capacity for the barebone fish resources in Qinghai Lake continues to strengthen, with the reserves increasing year by year.

Yang Lin, deputy director of the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Office of Qinghai Province, introduced that as of now, over 1.8 billion bareheaded carp have been artificially bred and released into Qinghai Lake, contributing over 23% to the recovery of its bareheaded carp resources.

The Qinghai Three Rivers Source Region is an essential ecological barrier and water source nurturing area for our country and even Asia. The Qinghai Lake serves as a natural barrier and functional area for the eastward expansion of the western aridification, controlling it.

To protect the ecological environment of the Three Rivers Source Area and Qinghai Lake, as well as the water wildlife, and maintain the biodiversity of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, this year, Qinghai successively issued notices on key water areas for the Yangtze River, the Yellow River, and Qinghai Lake, establishing a comprehensive ban management system for "one river, one river, one lake".
