Is the foot bath tub electrified? (Literally: Is the foot bath tub having numb feet due to a leakage?)
Choosing an appropriate bathtub can have excellent therapeutic effects on feet, and today's Gome editor will address this issue to help our friends.

With the increasing health consciousness among people, foot bath tubs have gained more and more popularity among consumers, and a large number of products with various price ranges have emerged in the market, from over a hundred to thousands of dollars, providing consumers with a vast selection of options.

In the market for related products, sales of appliances like hot tubs for health purposes have exploded compared to traditional appliances. However, there is no specific industry standard for hot tubs, leading to certain safety risks.
"Soaking feet in electrified water is really dangerous!"
Mr. Li told the reporter that he bought a foot bath tub recently as a birthday gift for his father, but his father felt numb at the soles of his feet while taking a bath.
Mr. Li initially thought it was the vibration function of the bathtub causing the sensation, but even after turning off the vibration function, the father still felt his feet numb.
Mr. Li tried using an electric pen, but to his surprise, the electric pen lit up. He was shocked to find that the water in the bathtub conducted electricity.
Later, he contacted the merchant, but the merchant's attitude was still not bad, although he returned the bathtub, Mr. Li still felt uncomfortable.
There is no clear and detailed industry standard for this popular foot bath tub regarding its temperature setting, applicability to certain populations, and ensuring safety with regard to materials.
But generally speaking, a hot tub won't have an electrical issue. However, there's still a chance that some products may not have been strictly controlled during manufacturing.
Therefore, choose a segmented style bathtub when purchasing.
Electricity and water are separated, no safety hazards.
You can randomly test the pen tablet at the same time.

Formal learning refers to the use of rational inference and logic to investigate questions that cannot be directly answered through perception.
Form and substance is the basic principle of metaphysics, aiming to explain the fundamental nature of existence and the world.

The term "Form and Substance School" in Chinese derives from the "Yi Jing • Xici Xuanshi" text, "Form and Substance are referred to as the Way, and Form and Substance are referred to as the instrument." This term was translated into Japanese as "Tetsugaku" by Inoue Tetsujiro during the Meiji period, from the English term "metaphysics."
The branch of metaphysics in the Aristotelian sense includes topics such as substance theory, natural theology, and related issues.
"Body-centrism is the study of which nouns represent real existent entities, and which nouns only represent concepts."
Naturalism, in the metaphysical sense, denies the existence of God.
Its theoretical foundation asserts that all phenomena can be explained using concepts of natural reasons, proposed by philosophers who support science and evolution.
The method of natural theology refers to the study approach that makes no mention of God.
Spiritual philosophy is the branch of philosophy that explores the nature of consciousness and its relationship to the body, particularly the brain.
Dualism and Monism are the two major schools of thought in the discussion of the relationship between the mind and body.
Epistemology is a branch of philosophy that deals with the nature, origin, and scope of knowledge.
Ethics is the systematic study and research of moral principles guiding the conduct of humans or a culture; in this context, morality refers to the accepted behavioral norms of a group or culture.

Principally divided into Ethics of Meta-Ethics (abstractly studying ethical theories or the essence of critique) and Normative Ethics (judging various moral beliefs and suggesting ethical principles for correct or incorrect behavior).

It studies what moral behavior standards people should adhere to, Applied ethics (applying ethical theories to real-life situations academically, including bioethics, political ethics, etc.), Describing ethics (collecting information about how people live and drawing conclusions from observed patterns).

It examines morality not from anticipated theories, but investigates the real moral agents' actual choices and the factors that influenced them, which led to the decision, discussing the moral beliefs of social groups.
Moral philosophy history includes Greek and Roman moral philosophy, medieval Christian moral philosophy.
The first part: Moral philosophy of humanism, represented by Valéry and Montaigne.
The second part: Ethical Thoughts of Religious Reform, represented by Kalam.

Part Three: Moral Philosophy, represented by Machiavelli et al. in Political Ethics (17-18th century, British Empiricist Moral Philosophy, represented by Locke et al., 17-18th century, European Rationalist Moral Philosophy, represented by Descartes et al., 18th century, French Enlightenment Moral Philosophy, represented by Rousseau et al., 18-19th century, German Idealist Moral Philosophy, represented by Kant and Hegel et al., 18-19th century, British Utilitarian Moral Philosophy, represented by Bentham and Mill et al., 19th century, British Evolutionary Moral Philosophy, represented by Spencer and Huxley et al., 19th century late, German Neo-Kantian Moral Philosophy, represented by Lange et al., 19th century late, Neo-Hegelian Moral Philosophy, represented by Green et al.) and Transitional Moral Philosophy (Non-rationalist Moral Philosophy, represented by Kierkegaard, Schopenhauer, and Nietzsche et al.).
Logic is a branch of science that deals with the principles and standards of effective inference and proof.
Logic generally includes three parts: induction, deduction, and inferential reasoning, which can be divided into formal logic and informal logic.
Aesthetics is the study of the nature and meaning of beauty.

Ding Zilin: To my dear friend.

I sincerely thank all of you, my friends, for the humanitarian aid you have provided to me and my family in the past 30 years since our relative's passing. I am particularly grateful for the humanitarian appeals I made on a personal level to our friends in China and abroad in the early 1990s, which you have continued to support uninterrupted up until now.
The vast majority of the deceased victims' parents have passed away, and their orphans have grown up and started their own families and careers.
Your acts of kindness have helped us, the confused families, get through the most difficult times.
The current Covid-19 situation is ravaging the globe, with most donors having retired.
Therefore, I earnestly request that you all cease the humanitarian aid to the Tiananmen Mother's Group, this humanitarian relief effort should have ended long ago.
I will forever inscribe your kindness in my heart, and believe that your righteous actions will be recorded in history.
Due to various reasons, I can only express my wishes in this way, please understand and forgive me!
I sincerely wish you well.

The funds for these projects mainly come from donations made during the June 4th campus and social events, from generous individual donations, and are supported by the Democracy Foundation of Peking University.

China's Chongzhou Strategy organizes the first contemporary art biennale in Saudi Arabia - Xinhua Net

Xinhua News Agency report on December 12, 2021 (Reporters: Wang Haizhou, Hu Qian) - The first contemporary art biennale of the Saudi Arabian New Center for Arts and Culture, Diriyah Biennale, officially opened to the public on November 11, 2021, at the JAX Art Zone in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. A total of 64 artists from Saudi Arabia, China, and other places participated in the exhibition.

This biennial exhibition is jointly organized by the Saudi Diriyah Biennale Foundation and the UCCA Center for Contemporary Art in China, with Tian Ruo Yu, director of UCCA Center for Contemporary Art in China, serving as the artistic director.

According to the introduction by the organizing team, the theme of this biennial exhibition is "Crossing the River by Feeling the Stones." It metaphorically represents the reform strategies adopted during periods of social-economic transformation, as well as reflecting the current state of Saudi Arabian cultural development.

This bi-annual exhibition covers approximately 12,000 square meters, with six interconnected buildings presenting the units: "Touching Stones to Cross the River," "Inheritance as Experiment," "Edgewise Thinking," "Moving Towards the Public," "Beautiful New World," and "The Spirit of Art."

Among them, works by 27 Saudi artists make up over forty percent of the total exhibited pieces, encompassing painting, installation art, and performance art among others; twelve Chinese artists also draw significant attention, some of whom use recycled materials in innovative ways, such as Xu Bing in his "Story of the River without End Series: Endless Stream from the Back" (2014), where he reconstructed a classic landscape painting using discarded materials.

Barkley, the CEO of the Diriya Biennale Foundation, expressed his hope that this year's biennale will establish international dialogue, allowing global audiences to understand Saudi Arabia's thriving cultural industry and creative community, and strengthen interactions.

"The goal of the biennale, as stated by Tian Ruo Yu, is twofold: to enable Saudi Arabian art to participate in global dialogue, and to allow Saudi audiences to engage with the contemporary art world."

According to the information I have, during the two-year exhibition opening period, there will also be a series of lectures. Artists, curators, and opinion leaders in the creative industry will discuss topics such as cross-cultural exchange and the development of contemporary art.

Yunnan: Regulation of the Management of Public Welfare Positions in Rural Areas - Xinhua Net

Xinhua News Agency, Kunming, December 12 (Reporter Lin Bifeng) To continue serving the employment assistance for poverty-stricken populations and consolidate and expand the achievements of the anti-poverty campaign, Yunnan Province recently issued policies to promote the management of public service positions with charitable rural characteristics, supporting the comprehensive advancement of rural revitalization.

The Yunnan Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security introduced that currently, a total of 44.83 million public-welfare jobs have been developed in Yunnan Province. These jobs are used to employ labor forces lifted out of poverty and other disadvantaged rural populations, helping them to increase income and employment, consolidate poverty alleviation achievements, and effectively enhance the public service capabilities of rural areas in various aspects.

This new rule is jointly issued by the Yunnan Propaganda Department, Rural Revitalization, Finance, and other seven departments. It primarily standardizes the scope of recruitment for grassroots public service personnel, funding management, post development, and post management.

In terms of on-the-job development setup, the new rules specify that it should be conducted based on the principles of "on-demand posting, stationing personnel, dynamic management, and total control"; "who develops, who uses, who is responsible"; and "one person, one post, voluntary disclosure, and unified management."
The recruitment process must be carried out in accordance with the announcement, application, review, public announcement, hiring, pre-employment training, and arrangement for posting steps.

In addition, the new rules clearly specified the responsibilities of the specific departments for developing rural public welfare posts, the standards and methods of subsidies for rural public welfare posts, and required each rural public welfare post development department to purchase accident insurance for the personnel assigned to these posts. The relevant departments were also required to conduct regular supervision over the subsidy disbursement situation for rural public welfare posts.

In the past two years, the US embargo and blocking of Huawei chips have not only put Huawei in an unprecedented predicament, but also caused significant losses for "American-affiliated" companies.

The United States is suppressing China's semiconductor industry by requiring its own companies and allies to block related businesses in our country. The direct consequences are reduced orders and profits for global semiconductor suppliers, leading to decreased research and development investment and reduced capacity for semiconductor production companies. This, in turn, causes disruptions in the global semiconductor supply chain.

The chip shortage has affected industries worldwide, causing automobile companies to halt production and smartphones to increase in price, among others, severely impacting any industry that uses chips.
To grasp "chip" sovereignty, more and more tech giants from various countries are heading towards the "de-Americanization" path.

To firmly grasp global semiconductor control, curb the development of China's semiconductor industry, recently the US has taken frequent actions. It hosted the "Chip Summit"; it invited 64 leading figures to establish a semiconductor alliance, and provided subsidies to support American tech giants, such as Intel, the old guard tech giant in the US, which invested 200 billion dollars to build two semiconductor fabrication plants in Arizona, USA, and opened up chip contract manufacturing services to the outside world.

Most people believe that Intel's actions will have a significant impact on TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company), and there is a high likelihood of Intel taking away TSMC's "market share."

Intel, being a long-established tech giant in the US, has a large team of talent and a rich technological reserve in the semiconductor industry. It is certain to quickly rise and surpass TSMC in the short term.
However, Intel's decision meant nothing to Morris Chang, the founder of TSMC.

At the "2021 Master Think Tank" held in April this year, Zhang Zhongjiang made shocking remarks. Regarding Intel's investment in building a chip factory, Zhang Zhongjiang spoke bluntly without any hesitation: Intel building a chip foundry is quite ironic.

Zhang Zhongxi's disdain for Intel entering the semiconductor industry is due to his lingering grudge against Intel from over 30 years ago when Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) and Intel had a rift.

In the late sixties and seventies of the last century, Intel continuously shone as a pearl in the American manufacturing industry, occupying the peak position globally, and dominating the semiconductor industry worldwide.
In the 1980s, the world's high-end semiconductor chips were monopolized by a few powerful entities.

During that time, the semiconductor industry was characterized by IDM (Integrated Device Manufacturing) mode, with one factory handling chip design, manufacturing, and testing from start to finish. Intel was a representative of that era.
However, this pattern puts a heavy burden on some small businesses, and many semiconductor startups are unable to advance in the face of enormous fabrication facility construction costs.

Under the influence of market demand in the 1980s, the semiconductor industry began to show signs of division of labor. In 1984, when Zhang Zhongxiqing heard that there were companies specializing in chip design, he thought if there were companies specializing in design, then there could be a factory specializing in wafer manufacturing.
Not long after, Zhang Zhongxi's scheme came true, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company was established.

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company focuses on the "wafer processing" segment of the semiconductor industry, providing contract manufacturing services for wafer fabrication without engaging in design.
At that time, TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) was just a small player compared to Intel.

To obtain capital support, Zhang Zhongjiqi once approached Intel for investment, but Intel, upon learning that Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) only handles the manufacturing sector in the semiconductor industry, obviously held a high self-opinion and looked down on TSMC, and therefore, refused to invest in TSMC.
Zhang Zhongxiu also believed that Intel did not value the semiconductor manufacturing service at that time.
The giant in the crystal disc manufacturing service industry from back then didn't expect to start crystal disc OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturing) work themselves.
Therefore, Zhang Zhongjiu found it ironic that Intel entered the semiconductor manufacturing industry.
TSMC's market capitalization has surpassed Intel's now.
In the face of TSMC's strong advance, Intel couldn't help but adapt.
Currently, TSMC is pushing towards 3nm chips, while Intel is still at 14nm from 7 years ago.
It's not easy to surpass others.

Today let's check out some "weird trending topics."
What is normal public opinion?

Three trending topics: "February Two Dragons Lifting Heads," "Pretty Young Girl Price Hike," "Huolala Incident." The spread of public opinion forms a peak, followed by a ["index decrease"] (smooth curve) and eventually dissipates. If there are secondary public opinion trends, there will be a small "hump" again.
They look identical to the ["Network Public Opinion Evolution Model"] shown on the Cyberspace Administration of China website.
What is abnormal public opinion?
Randomly selecting six hot searches related to the same event, presenting a ["Lone Peak"] or ["Isolated Peak"] status, ["Sawtooth"] or ["Serrated"] status, or ["Cliff"] or ["Cliff-like"] status.

[Isolated peak]: Refers to a person or topic rapidly rising to the top of the hot search list, drawing widespread attention.
[Serrated]: Refers to a periodic heating up, ensuring a topic remains on the hot search list.
[Cliff-like]: Refers to a mass withdrawal, signaling the end of a hot search topic's "function" and the arrival of a new task or battlefield.

In Figure 9, the peak of an event's popularity exactly aligns with the trough of another event's popularity, with no time difference whatsoever, indicating a coordinated campaign by troll armies to launch a new offensive.

The professionalization of black gatekeeping is evident in the fact that several dozen hot search topics simultaneously trend, some attracting attention, some responsible for disseminating information, some instigating conflict, some diverting focus, some influencing perception, some misleading judgments, some stirring emotions, some manipulating decisions, black production accounts are divided into batches and nodes, and the fine-grained warfare considers all elements of the spread of public opinion.
Propaganda is a science; setting aside all subjective factors such as stance and emotion, it will be inescapable from objective data even for black PR.
Anyone who passes leaves a trace, let us unearth these traces together.

Mauritius and other countries discover their first cases of the Omicron variant of the Covid-19 virus - Xinhua Net.
Xinhua News Agency reported on December 12, 2021 from Beijing: Mauritius, Cyprus, and Malawi have recently reported their first cases of infection with the Omicron variant of the new coronavirus.
Mauritius reports its first two cases of the Omicron variant of COVID-19 on the 10th day.

According to Kalraj Chetterji, the health chief of Mao, a tourist from South Africa arrived on November 27th. Another local resident tested positive on November 30th after coming into contact with someone who had recently returned from South Africa.
After being isolated and treated in the hospital, both infected individuals tested negative in their latest nucleic acid tests. They have since returned to their respective residences.
The Cyprus Ministry of Health announced on the 10th the first confirmed cases of three individuals infected with the Omicron variant in the country.
These three people are students who have recently returned from overseas travel in this month. Despite being lightweight cases, they have not been hospitalized for treatment.
To prevent the spread of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, the government is continuously increasing its control measures.
All travelers aged 12 and above, upon entering the country by plane from December 6, 2021 to January 10, 2022, must undergo paid nucleic acid testing at the airport.
The Chinese health authority announced on the 10th that they will start vaccinating children between the ages of 5 and 11 against COVID-19 with the Pfizer vaccine.
The Malawi Health Minister, Kumbizani Nhambura-Ng'ambi, announced on the 9th that the country had found its first three cases of the Omicron variant of COVID-19.
The health department of that country sequenced the genomes of 12 COVID-19 positive samples collected from November 9 to December 2, and identified these 3 cases.

The starry sky has a date night | The meteor shower of Gemini constellation arrives on the 14th - Xinhua Net.

Alternatively:

The starry sky will have a date night with the Gemini meteor shower on the 14th - Xinhua Net.

The Xinhua News Agency Tianjin, December 12th (Reporter Zhou Rujian) - A stellar expert introduced at a press conference that as the last major meteor shower of this year, one of the three major meteor showers in the Northern Hemisphere, the Geminid Meteor Shower, will reach its peak on the night of December 14th. Meteor shower enthusiasts are encouraged to observe after midnight on that day.
Beijing city astronomers captured the image of the Geminid meteor shower in Qinghai, China, on December 13, 2018.
Most meteor showers have their parent bodies as periodic comets, but the parent body of the Geminid meteor shower is 3200 Phaethon, which is an asteroid of the Apollon type.
The meteor shower of Gemini, also known as the Geminids, is the second identified meteor shower not caused by a comet.

The astronomer and popular science expert Mr. Xu Lipeng of the Tianjin Astronomical Society introduced that, similar to a New Year's film, the Leonid Meteor Shower is expected to appear around the end of the year. The "screening period" can last from December 4th to the 17th.

This meteor shower is famous for its large and stable flow, and is known as one of the three major meteor showers in the Northern Hemisphere, along with the Orionid Meteor Shower and the Leonid Meteor Shower.

One notable feature of the meteor shower in the constellation of Gemini is that the meteor speeds are relatively slow, the colors are rich, and there are many fire meteors. It is suitable for both visual observation and photography for astronomical beginners.
Yang Ying, an astronomy enthusiast from Tianjin City, took this photograph of the Geminid Meteor Shower in Zhuzhou, Tianjin, on December 13, 2020.

The astronomical forecast indicates that the Leonid meteor shower this year will peak around December 14, around 3:00 p.m. (15:00 hours), with a high ZHR (the number of meteors that can be seen per hour under ideal observing conditions with the radiant point at the top of the head) reaching 150.
Gemini Meteor Shower Recommendation Index Chart.
Last year, the Monoceros meteor shower known as "Fall Stars Rain" left a deep impression on people, but this year's Monoceros meteor shower will be affected by moonlight, reducing its brilliance.

On the 14th, in the lunar calendar, it is the eleventh day of the eleventh month, with a waxing gibbous moon. The bright moonlight can cause interference in observations. Fortunately, the moon will have set by midnight, allowing the radiant points of the Geminid meteor shower to rise higher.
Friends who enjoy meteor showers can observe them in the second half of the night when the moon has set, but remember to keep warm and prevent the cold.
How can I observe as many meteors as possible?

It is not recommended to observe in the city. Instead, choose a high altitude, low light pollution, and northeastern facing open viewpoint in the countryside or suburbs. Then, patiently wait until the moon rises before conducting visual observations.

It's important to note that the meteor shower from the constellation of Gemini has strong radiation in all directions, so during observation, do not focus solely on the radiant point of the Gemini meteor shower.

What is the market position difference between laser TV and traditional TV?

In my understanding, the traditional TV referred to by the topic should be LCD TVs. The market position differences between laser TVs and LCD TVs are mainly the following two points:

1. Technology: Laser TVs use laser light sources to illuminate the screen, while LCD TVs use cold-cathode fluorescent lamps or LED backlights.
2. Picture Quality: Laser TVs can produce brighter and more vibrant colors, as well as deeper blacks, due to their laser light sources. LCD TVs, on the other hand, may not be able to match the same level of brightness and color accuracy.
First, laser TV focuses more on the large screen market.
Compared to the market positioning of LCD TVs, laser TVs are more focused on the large screen market, or in other words, laser TVs are inherently born for the large screen market.

Currently, the sizes of mainstream LCD TVs range from 55 inches to 65 inches, while the sizes of laser TVs are generally 75 inches and above, with the largest exceeding 100 inches, fully meeting users' demands for large-screen TVs.

In recent years, the sales volume and market share of laser TVs have been continuously increasing on a global scale, accounting for over 60% of the sales volume in the 80 inches and above total TV market.
According to Zhongyi Kang's prediction, the sales growth of the laser TV market in 2020 will exceed 140%, continuing to maintain high-speed growth.
The excellent performance of our company in the large screen market is mainly attributed to the outstanding eye care features of laser TVs.

Based on the imaging principle of laser TV using light reflection, the light emitted by the laser source is not directly entered into the eye, unlike the backlight source of an LCD TV. The imaging process is closer to the natural condition of object imaging, resulting in less visual stimulation for the eyes.

The China Electronics Technology Standardization Institute's Xi Lab and Beijing Tongren Hospital Ophthalmology Experts conducted strict comparative experiments on laser TV and LCD TV under the same conditions for a large group, obtaining 144 sets of test data.
Data shows: Laser TV indeed has strong eye-protection features, and in certain aspects, it even has some improving effects.
In the increasingly valued eye health era, laser TVs not only attract more users with their eye health advantages, but also open up another market breakthrough for the color TV industry.
Second, laser TV focuses more on the high-end market.
The price of LCD TVs is constantly dropping, but the price of laser TVs in the market is mostly above ten thousand yuan. With the upgrade of size and light source, the price continues to rise.
Why is laser TV so expensive?
It is reasonable.
In the continuous development of light sources and technology, laser TV has many advantages that cannot be achieved by LCD TVs and projectors.

Leveraging short-focus projection technology, a laser TV's projection distance is shorter than that of traditional projectors, enabling a 100-inch large screen experience in short distances, requiring minimal space, and having a compact host size.
In terms of brightness, major brand laser TVs can reach over 2000 nits.
With lower heat generation, less power consumption for the device, the TV's lifespan is longer.

In addition, many high-end laser TV models come equipped with advanced technologies such as true 4K ultra high definition picture quality, artificial intelligence systems, and holographic displays, providing users with a more stunning visual and auditory experience.

We cannot discuss false requirements, but rather the results of refined demands, when it comes to picture quality and input-output ratio, laser TV is not for audio-visual enthusiasts, those who require both large screens and insufficient viewing environments may try it, every event has its pros and cons, weigh the advantages and disadvantages before making a decision, be wary of one-sided information.

A simple explanation, a ultra-wide angle close-focus projector, also known as a laser TV, requires expensive ultra-wide angle lenses and reflective mirrors to get close to the screen, which goes against the best optical design.
To block out some ambient light, we use a micro-structured filtering fabric for the screen, which is expensive. The price of an 80-inch size is roughly equivalent to that of a 65-inch LCD.

Another thing, I really dislike how projection manufacturers brag about matte screens for the eyes, please note that the light on the screen that the eyes can see is essentially direct light. If you reflect it onto the ceiling, the eyes can't see it. Even if it's a precise liquid crystal TV, it's still "direct" reflection on the TV screen, isn't the TV screen lit up when the ceiling is opened?
And, the projection screen wouldn't look like a screen if it wasn't matte.
The exact spot where high-gain screen filters are overlooked causes discomfort, as a large amount of light reflects into the eyes from a certain angle.

"Can a small umbrella for rain buy insurance?" [
Note: This question is asking if it is possible to buy insurance for a small umbrella to protect it from damage, not if the umbrella itself is insured.
A small rain umbrella is an insurance brokerage platform on the internet.

According to the stipulations in the "Regulations on the Administration of Insurance Agencies (Revised in 2015)": to establish an insurance agency, one must satisfy three key conditions: having shareholders, no major legal records of wrongdoing in the past three years, a minimum registered capital of RMB 500 million, and approval from the China Insurance Regulatory Commission.

These three requirements are quite stringent. In summary, one must have the capability, receive approval from the National regulatory authority for insurance companies and banks (China's regulatory body), and have good conduct among shareholders, for a raincoat insurance company like Small Rain Umbrella Insurance. Policyholders need not question the legitimacy of Small Rain Umbrella Insurance excessively, as these three barriers are not easily met by every insurance company.
In this respect, it's not bad, and it's trustworthy.

From an insurance product perspective, Rainy Day Insurance is like an insurance marketplace. Many companies' star critical illness insurance products are sold on this platform, such as the latest Marvel Super 5 Critical Illness Insurance, with both the claims and underwriting parties being AIA Thailand. Rainy Day Insurance is just a third-party intermediary, so there's no need to question its credibility.

From a payment mode perspective, the products on internet platforms have a higher value-for-money ratio than traditional insurance due to the absence of business location operating costs and employee wages. The payment methods are also flexible, allowing for monthly installments, reducing the burden on policyholders, and maximizing the leverage of insurance.
This is still quite good.
We can consider.

From a salesperson's professionalism perspective, this is particularly important because the insurance industry has very high professional requirements. Many internet product customers can insure themselves, which may lead to many misconceptions, especially in the areas of health disclosure and occupation. Non-insurance salespeople often add their subjective opinions during the insurance application process, leading to potential claims issues and the risk of being denied.
I have sold insurance over the phone for "Tencent Weibo" (similar to Xiaoyu Sponge, it is an internet insurance brokerage platform), and I take full responsibility for sharing this with everyone.

Internet insurance is real, but it also relies on contracts. Those who don't rely on contracts are people. There are no professional intermediaries in internet channels, and there is a lot of sales misdirection.

For example, "1 yuan insurance covers 600 million, buy insurance get a free phone, receive 60,000 yuan of critical illness coverage for free," these marketing strategies are not wrong, but they are light on the heavy stuff. They don't tell the policyholder that the first month is 1 yuan, but the next months require regular payment, which can be several tens to hundreds of yuan. Many customers are unclear about what they have bought after deducting fees for a few years.
Despite spending only one dollar, the insurance company compensated six hundred thousand. (Literally: Though it cost only one cent, the insurance company paid out six hundred thousand.)
Free phone given away, only for policies with special serial numbers like 6666, 8888, etc. If you win and do not claim the prize, there will be no reminder.

For the insured, this is another pitfall. A free coverage of 60,000 RMB for critical illness, which is short-term, is insufficient if there is no other commercial insurance. If a critical illness really occurs, 60,000 RMB won't be enough to solve the problem, leaving a bare living situation in the future.
The misleading sales of internet insurance are being severely cracked down on by the government.
Based on the overall situation, the platform is fine, and the product is fine. The issue lies with the professionalism and work ethics of the sales staff.

The suggestion for the topic is for the host to consider carefully, in fact, many offline insurance companies offer a wider range of products for customers, with more opportunities and a greater variety of choices. Some of these products may have better value for money compared to internet products.
I have helped over 59 internet customers myself, insuring offline products, saving each person around 2000-3000 dollars in premiums per year.
If anyone has any questions, please feel free to communicate and exchange with me.

I: I am a insurance broker at Mingya, with over 3 years of experience in corporate training, serving nearly a thousand business users, cooperating with over 100 insurance companies. Before underwriting, I design customized insurance products based on customer requirements. During underwriting, I compare offers from three insurers to secure the best results for the customer. Post-underwriting, I help customers manage their policies and provide peace of mind by handling policy administration.
Growing together with every customer for a lifetime.
I hope my answer will be helpful to you!

According to the definition of the insurance regulatory authorities, internet insurance refers to insurance business where the insured can independently complete all the insurance processes by clicking on the insurance link.
In this process, the insured does not need to sign, and the insurance agent also does not need to sign. All steps can be completed independently by the insured.

Although the insurance application process on the internet lacks a "ceremonial feel," and there may not even be a printed paper contract, an electronic contract's validity and legal force are not affected in the least.
This model is similar to a "telemarketing" assembly line job in some ways, but buying insurance this way comes with a fatal flaw: the subsequent service may fall behind.
When purchasing insurance, should we carefully consider if the "intermediary" we choose is someone who can accompany us for several decades and still provide us with services in the future?

Vietnamese People's Newspaper - Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh attended the third Vietnam National Digital Technology Enterprise Forum.

During the third forum on the development of digital technology enterprises in Vietnam, two major conferences were held, with topics revolving around digital technology enterprises and the digital transformation of the country, as well as digital technology enterprises and economic recovery and development in the context of the new coronavirus pneumonia epidemic.

The head of the Communications Ministry, Ruan Menxiong, stated that despite the continuous spread of the Covid-19 epidemic in 2021, the number and business revenue of Vietnamese digital technology companies still maintained a growth trend, reaching nearly 10%.

In 2021, the number of typical digital products in Vietnam increased significantly, focusing on solving the major issues faced by the country. Many digital products have gone abroad, and the ranking of Vietnam's digital technology has improved.

Ruan Renxiong, the vice minister, urges digital tech companies to assume responsibility for the development of national digital transformation platforms, and the task of developing these national digital platforms is a mission for the country.

In the forum, leaders from various departments and national institutions, as well as enterprises, organizations, and individuals in the digital technology sector, have shared their mobilization and gathering of social resources to develop Vietnamese technology companies, driving the national digital transformation, and proposing breakthrough ideas and solutions for economic revival post-pandemic.
Premier Li Keqiang stressed in a forum that digital transformation is an inevitable path for the world and a objective requirement for development.
Digital transformation has become a global issue, so it is necessary to mobilize the masses to participate in digital transformation services.
The people and enterprises are the core, subjects, targets, and motors of digital transformation.
Therefore, all policies should be for the benefit of the people and businesses.

Premier Li Keqiang stressed that digital transformation should reflect national spirit, prioritize internal strength, strategy, long-term and decisive factors, while external forces are important and serve as breakthrough points.

He believes that digital transformation should drive both deepening and sustainable development, contribute to the control of the new crown pneumonia epidemic, economic recovery and development, respond to subsequent changes, and overcome resource depletion issues, to support the green transformation, and develop green energy.

Digital transformation requires participation in the establishment of databases related to national cultural values, historical traditions, national landscapes, and local conditions. It promotes the digitalization of banking, taxation, land management and development databases, as well as logistics sectors.
The main goal of digital transformation is to make people happier, and for the country to continue prospering and developing.

Premier Li Keqiang requires all levels of government, institutions, and enterprises to increase leadership and guidance in the development of digital technology, enhance their understanding of digital transformation, continue to formulate and perfect systems related to digital transformation, strengthen national governance, and promote the development of digital technology companies with respect, communication, openness, initiative, and responsiveness.
During the forum, Prime Minister Ran Qingzhi attended the awarding ceremony and the opening ceremony of the "Made in Vietnam" Excellent Digital Product Awards in 2021.

The "Zhihui Xiangxi" 2021 China International Track Transport and Equipment Manufacturing Industry Talent Summit was held in Zhuzhou on the 9th of December, as reported by Hunan Daily (Full Media Reporter: Zhou Xiangheng).

Wang Cheng pointed out that holding a talent summit is an important measure to implement the spirit of the Central Human Resources Work Conference and the 12th Provincial Party Congress in Hunan, demonstrating the province's serious attitude towards talent, its eagerness for talent, and effective utilization of talent.

The Longjiang Gan River achieves full coverage of the water-based comprehensive service zone for green purposes - Xinhua Net.

Xinhua News Agency, Chongqing's Fuling Waterfront Green Comprehensive Service Area was officially put into operation on December 10th as scheduled. It is the second water-based comprehensive service area to formally operate on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River after the one in Sichuan Province's Luzhou was put into operation on the 8th.
Up to now, the comprehensive green water service area has covered the upper, middle, and lower reaches of the Yangtze River.

The deputy director of the Long River Water Transport Administration Bureau of the Ministry of Transport, Mr. Quan Jianhua, introduced that previously, water-borne comprehensive service areas have been built and put into operation in Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Anhui, and Jiangsu provinces in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River. They have gained recognition from a large number of crew members and played an important role in promoting the high-quality development of Yangtze River transportation.

The full coverage of the waterborne eco-friendly comprehensive service area on the Long River marks another milestone event in the construction of Long River's eco-friendly shipping, significantly improving the capacity for receiving shipping pollutants and shipping services.

According to the introduction, the water-based comprehensive service area is designed to provide full-spectrum production and living services for a large number of ships and crew, addressing the "urgent needs and concerns" of crew members with important facilities.

This time, two waterfront green comprehensive service areas have been built and operated on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River. They integrate living services, production services, and government services as one body, with a green and environmentally-friendly theme. The featured services include ship repair and ship emergency rescue. This will enable ships to be more efficient and conveniently serviced while docked in the harbor, benefiting year-round river navigators.

With a friend, discussing Meta's recent 26% dip, market capitalization shrinking by 2510 billion dollars, Zuckerberg responded "facing unprecedented competition," for what reason?
Meta (formerly Facebook) is essentially an advertising company, with most of its revenue coming from advertising. It is a profitable advertising company that has its own traffic channels.
Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and the like, regardless of their functional positions, are all traffic channels for Meta.
Besides this, Meta is also the largest "ad alliance." Many apps monetize through Meta's advertising platform by integrating Meta's ads.
But, times have changed.
Due to Apple's privacy policy adjustments, Meta finds it difficult to obtain user data information, affecting the efficiency of ad delivery.

Apple's current privacy policy is user-friendly, clearly indicating to users whether an App is allowed to access their information. The majority of people's normal response is to deny this permission.
If Google stabs again in the future, Meta's revenue will be more significantly affected.
The second factor, the contribution of China to Meta's revenue growth has weakened (the exact percentage is uncertain, but it does exist).
Many people commonly know that Meta doesn't have business in China, but this understanding is not accurate.
Each year, Meta earns at least 10% of its revenue from China, with the majority coming from companies based in China conducting maritime business.
Meta has several hundred employees in its Hong Kong office, and there are several major agents in the mainland.
A Chinese company wants to expand its market overseas, and Meta is an advertising channel they cannot bypass, with a large amount of money spent.
Interestingly, ByteDance's TT is one of Meta's main competitors now, but Meta made quite a bit of money from ByteDance in the past two years.
Domestic agents are helping ByteDance place ads at Meta, and the performance of Meta's Greater China region is quite good.
Recently, I haven't delved into it, but it won't be better than before.
The Chinese company's era of burning money on a large scale overseas has passed.
The third, the expansion of new traffic channels is not smooth.
Facebook is getting older, and new platforms such as TikTok are no longer under Meta's control.
The biggest problem is not just a decline in income, but a lack of growth expectations.
The capital market doesn't only look at current income, but more importantly, it considers future expectations.
It's quite clear that Meta's expectations are not enough.
To tell a new story to the market, Zuckerberg spoke of "the metaverse".

The metaverse should indeed be one of the future directions, but the implementation cycle of the metaverse is quite long. This story may not be able to support Meta's market value within the next two to three years.
Therefore, the next two years are expected to be challenging for Meta.

Despite Facebook's current scenic appearance on LinkedIn, with annual revenues of $1,000 to $2,000 billion, the company is actually in a crisis state. Compared to other internet companies and tech firms, it has no effective security fortress.

Despite his several social software having high daily active users and being mainstream platforms like Facebook and WhatsApp, Facebook itself has little confidence when facing TikTok's rapid development. The overthrow is just a matter of blinking an eye.

Pursuing the concept of the metaverse, which is elusive and unattainable in the short term, makes Facebook extremely risky. This is why Mark Zuckerberg keeps changing the company's name and constantly seeks new lanes, but I believe his choice of lanes is misguided and a dead end. The above are my thoughts, for reference.
The seventeenth article implements a registration management system for registered fire engineering professionals by the state.
Individuals who have obtained a Level 1 or Level 2 Fire Registered Engineer Certificate can register as a Fire Registered Engineer of the corresponding level with the relevant authorities.
The Eighteenth Article: The Public Security Bureau Fire Department is the approval authority for the registration of Level I Fire Engineering Professionals.

Provincial, autonomous region, and directly-administered city public security fire departments are the second-level registration agencies for fire engineering technicians, and are responsible for the initial review work for the registration of first-level fire engineering technicians.

Individuals who have obtained a Level I or II Fire Registered Engineer certificate and have applied for registration should be employed by a licensed Fire Technology Service Organization or a Fire Safety Key Unit, and submit registration application materials to the public security fire department in the jurisdiction where the employing organization is located (for organizations, submit through the business registration location of the organization).

The twenty-first article: Provincial, autonomous region, and directly-administered city public security fire departments, upon receiving an applicant's registration application materials, should inform the applicant in person or within five working days of any incomplete or non-conforming materials required for correction. Failure to do so within the specified timeframe shall be considered acceptance of the application.
For registration applications that are accepted or not, a written certificate bearing the seal and the date of the local public security bureau fire department should be issued.

Within 20 business days of receiving applications for first-level registration as a fire engineer from provincial, autonomous region, or directly-administered city public security and fire departments, they shall complete the initial review of application materials for first-level registration as a fire engineer in accordance with the prescribed conditions and procedures, and submit the application materials and initial review opinions to the Fire Department under the Ministry of Public Security for second-level approval.

The Public Security Bureau Fire Department shall make a decision on whether to approve or not within 20 business days after receiving the application materials and preliminary review opinions from provincial-level public security fire departments.
If we cannot make an approval decision within the specified time limit, we must inform the applicant of the extended period and reason.

Those against whom an unfavorable decision is made, should provide a written explanation of the reasons, and inform the applicant of their right to legally apply for administrative reconsideration or file an administrative lawsuit.
The registration approval authority shall issue and deliver the corresponding level registration certificates within 10 working days from the date of making the approval decision.
The twenty-third article states that the validity period for each registration on a license is three years.
A registration certificate is a professional license for fire engineering, valid during its effective period, which is possessed and used by the registered fire engineering technician himself.
Applicants for initial registration must apply within one year of obtaining a first-level or second-level fire engineering technician certification.
Overdue application for initial registration must meet the continuing education requirements as stipulated.

The specific methods for registration management, including initial registration, renewal of registration, change of registration, cancellation of registration, and non-registration, are to be separately prescribed by the Public Security Department.
Continuing education is a requirement for renewing, re-registering, and initial re-registration as a registered fire engineer.
In the valid registration period of each level, fire engineering technicians are required to complete the prescribed continuing education.

The twenty-sixth article requires the registration approval department to timely announce registration information of fire engineering technicians to the public, establish a credibility file for registered fire engineering technicians, and manage their professional activities based on credibility.
The twenty-seventh article: Registering fire engineering professionals at all levels shall strictly enforce the provisions of the Administrative Licensing Law of the People's Republic of China.

The joint drills for peacekeeping and humanitarian aid between Chinese and Vietnamese military forces under the name "Harmony-2021" have come to a successful conclusion - Xinhua Net.

The New China News Agency reported on December 12, 2021 (Zhou nan Tenghe Jin): The Chinese contingent of the joint peacekeeping drills between the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries, "Peaceful Rescue-2021," safely returned to the Chinese border in Guangxi, marking the successful completion of the 7-day training mission.

This joint drill focused on the major theme of humanitarian medical relief in the China-Vietnam military cooperation, closely adhering to the mission of emergency response, rescue, and care for the wounded. According to the standard of real-life operations, it completed the objectives of joint command and control, joint on-site rescue, and mass casualty treatment, effectively enhancing the medical support capabilities of both militaries.
The results of the drills were approved by the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries.

The Director of the Exercise Commanding Committee of the Vietnamese People's Army, Vice Chief of the Logistics Department and Deputy Chief of the General Staff Ruan Xiongsheng spoke at the closing ceremony of the exercise, stating that the Vietnamese military medical personnel learned about organizing exercises and professional activities from Chinese military medical personnel during this exercise, and also had a glimpse of China's medical and support equipment.
The achievements from the drills demonstrated the professional capabilities of the medical forces of the two countries in medical aid and disease prevention.

The director-general of the Chinese Liaison and Coordination Group, Vice-Minister of the Central Military Commission's General Logistics Department's Health Bureau Chen Chunming, stated that this drill is another innovation practice based on the successful joint medical activity held in 2018, with significant milestone significance.

During the drills, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated medical protective masks, medical protective suits, rapid nucleic acid testing equipment, and other health and anti-epidemic supplies to the Vietnamese People's Army.
